title.rendered: Capt. Darren Dumont joins our Houston office

content.rendered:
AqualisBraemar is delighted to announce the addition of a new Master Mariner, Capt. Darren Dumont, to the growing team in our Houston office.

Capt. Dumont has over twenty years of operational seafaring experience and the past five years as a marine surveyor and consultant. He has served in leadership roles including time as ship’s Master, Class 1 Ships Pilot and project consultant on various vessel types including passenger vessels, chemical tankers, VLCC’s and offshore anchor handlers. As a certified appraiser, Darren has consulted on a wide range of due diligence projects for financial institutions, including fleet reviews and valuations. In his role as a surveyor, he has undertaken assignments for hull and machinery Underwriters and represented the interests of P&I Clubs.

Darren is a graduate of Maine Maritime Academy with a BSc in Nautical Science, as well as a graduate of Lloyds Maritime Academy with a Higher National Diploma in Marine Surveying and Warranty Surveying.

He holds a USCG Unlimited Master of Steam and Motor Vessels (Class 1 Certificate of Competency) and also holds an FAA Unmanned Aircraft System Remote Pilot Rating for drone operations.

With his deep background and experience, Darren will be a fantastic addition to our technical team.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar adds salvage expert to growing London team
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We are delighted to announce that we have continued the process of strengthening our Marine team and service offerings to the P&I market with Jason Bennett joining the London team.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Capt. Deddy Setiyatno
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The team at AqualisBraemar share the passion, vision and values for working in energy and the world’s oceans, de-risking and driving the energy transition. We are driven by the idea that the best work is born from professionalism, diligence… and fun.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Veteran Mariner gets into the groove again
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: A veteran of the North Sea, Maurice Pickles, has returned to marine consultancy being appointed as Marine Manager with AqualisBraemar Ltd based in Aberdeen. As well as being a Master Mariner, Maurice, is also known as the Lead Guitarist of the well regarded local classic rock and blues Roadhouse Band.…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar strengthens London marine team
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We are delighted to announce that we have continued to strengthen our Marine team with Paul Martin joining the London team as Director of P&I Services.

jetpack-related-posts.title: New head of Middle East for Aqualis
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 30 August 2016 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Ben Lazenby as director of the company’s Middle East operation, which now counts five offices in four different countries. Ben Lazenby succeeds Reuben Segal, who will now concentrate fully on his role as Chief Operating Officer of AqualisBraemar.…

jetpack-related-posts.title: New European head for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has appointed Mark Lomas as director of the company’s European operation.
